intro: Maytenus revoluta subsp. revoluta, commonly known as the Mexican white cedar, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to southern Mexico. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and lanceolate,革质 (leathery) leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers followed by orange-red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. It is often found in humid, well-drained soils in lowland and foothill areas.
